152501.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 200 - Apr 1992)
152501.description:
Alarums & Excursions
Issue #200
April 1992

Cover art by John Kingsbury.

152502.name: Musaic Box

videogamehonor.32139: 2009 IGF Awards Excellence In Audio Nominee

152502.description:
“Musaic Box” is the original and very peculiar game based on an unusual idea to collect music from the individual fragments. To restore the melody, you need to find the sheet music, hidden in the house of a collector of old musical instruments. Numerous musical puzzles, which used well-known melodies, much to the benefit music and puzzle lovers.

Game “Musaic Box” reached the final of the Festival of Independent Games 2009 IGF Award in two categories: Excellence in Audio and Excellence in Design, the latest of which took first place. At the Seventh International Conference KRI game developers in Moscow game received an award as “Best Casual Game”.

Source: The Publisher Website.

152503.name: Yumsters! 2: Around The World
152503.description:
“Yumsters!” sequel telling about the adventures of the charming Yumsters to different countries of the world. What awaits you in the way? More fruits, new location, wonderful music and new Yumsters characters.

Source: The Publisher Website.

152504.name: Ravaged Zombie Apocalypse
152504.description:
User Summary

Ravaged is a first-person shooter online multi-player game where players take the role of survivors in a post-apocalyptic world, and fight over the scarce remains of the land.

There is a heavy focus on vehicle combat, and it delivers more than 40 different weapons and vehicles to blow your friends (and foes) to pieces.

152505.description:
Íslandssöguspilið is at it's base a roll & move game, with some cards that help you affect other players, by slowing them down or moving their pawns back.

From the back of the box:
An exciting race through Icelandic history. Take part in a race through Icelandic history from the Age of Settlement to the current era. Learn about the persons and events that have shaped the country and it's people.
152505.name: Íslandssöguspilið

152506.name: Gnoll Hide: Classic Monsters Reskinned
152506.description:
From publisher blurb:

Something about gnolls has always fired up my imagination. I mean, they’re demon-worshiping hyena people. What’s not to love? In my own Desteon campaign setting I use them the way Native Americans were (inaccurately) portrayed in a lot of Westerns. They’re denizens of the New World, wandering the plains, attacking settlers and caravans with reckless abandon and calculated brutality. I picture them as the ultimate chaos warriors, wandering around setters’ towns and villages for no other reason than they’re there, dying their fur wild colors, painting things with strange, otherworldly designs. They’re the reavers from Firefly. They’re the Batman’s Joker at his most psychotic. They commit atrocities because they find them entertaining and while they do, they laugh, and laugh, and laugh. In my world, gnolls are scary and insane.

To make things a little less black-and-white, I also have the gnolls playing an important part in the ecosystem. They’re scavengers. They let nothing go to waste. If the find a carcass that another predator has left, they utilize it. Bones and sinew and flesh and hair all get re-purposed and recycled and used for tools and traps. When gnolls do leave a body behind, it’s to serve as a message to others. If they wipe a human settlement out of existence, should it really have been there in the first place? Not that conservation is an excuse for mindless brutality, but wiping out a tribe of gnolls usually results in unintended consequences.

Gnoll Hide tries to add a little depth and variety to a race that’s been second-tier at best since the 1st edition. I try to present not just alternate block stats, but some possibilities on how they might be more effectively utilized in your own campaign world.

152507.name: Troll Hide: Classic Monsters Reskinned
152507.description:
From publisher blurb:

Trolls in fantasy games are the equivalent of birthday candles that won’t blow out. I remember my first, frustrating encounter with them back in 1st edition. We kept hacking away at them, and they kept healing the damage we’d done. I think the first time I lost a player character was to a troll that regenerated faster than we could hurt it. My hatred of these things was palpable.

As a gamemaster I’ve very rarely used trolls in my game, especially against lower-level characters, because I’m not a “killer GM”. Bumping off characters for sport isn’t my idea of fun. In published adventures, I tended to swap out other creatures, usually ogres or hill giants, the types of creatures that equated to the trolls of myth and legend. I don’t recall the things that lived under bridges and harassed billy goats having a healing factor like Wolverine.

Yet they are an iconic monster, and people expect them. There are players that actually like to fight them. So I needed to find ways to make them interesting, palatable to my tastes, and to give them some logical and rational reason for existence in my own campaign world of Desteon. That meant that I either had to make them into sympathetic characters, or weave them into the overall ecology in my world building. In Troll Hide, I’ve done a little of both. Hopefully, you can use this information to make the trolls in your game more than just a go-to hack-and-slash encounter.

152508.name: Escaletto: Das neue Rechenspiel
152508.description: Each player has 5 meeples. To win the game the players must get them from the spaces 1-5 to the spaces 41-45 and then roll a 1 to get them on the colored triangle. To move their meeples one space they must roll a number by which the number on the space above them can be divided. This way more than one meeple can be moved per turn. If a 1 is rolled, all five meeples can move.

152509.name: Horch Memory
152509.description:
Pick up two of the face-down tin cans, shake each one. If the sounds are identical, you have a matching pair, keep it, and search for the next pair.
The 12 pairs of tin cans have transparent covers, each pair contains different seeds of different size, weight (and color, though the latter does not play a big role here – one could use it also as a standard memory game for hearing-impaired people, of course). Some similar sized seeds produce VERY similar sounds, so the game is not at all easy.
The game box also contains a booklet explaining the different seeds in detail (it unfortunately does not explain the game rules, but then any one familiar with Memory games will not need any explanation).
"Horch" is kind of an old-fashioned German word for "Listen!".

164368.name: The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King Deck-Building Game – Faramir Promos

boardgameintegration.127127: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring Deck-Building Game

152510.description:
Game description from the publisher:

In The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King Deck-Building Game, you take on the role of Frodo, Legolas, Aragorn, or one of their brave and heroic allies in the struggle against the forces of the Dark Lord Sauron! While you begin armed only with the courage of the free peoples of Middle-earth, you will add new, more powerful cards to your deck as you go. Your goal is to defeat the deadly forces that serve Sauron as you make way towards Mount Doom to destroy The One Ring.

Each player takes on the role an iconic hero from The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King including Aragorn, Éowyn, King Théoden, Legolas & Gimli, Frodo & Samwise, Merry, or Pippin. Each hero comes with a special card unique to that character and usable only by that player.

Each player starts with his own basic ten-card deck and draws a hand of five cards each turn. Power is the currency you will use to buy new, stronger cards to add to your deck. The goal of a deck-building game is to craft your personal deck into a well-oiled machine with the six types of cards that can be acquired: Enemies, Allies, Artifacts, Maneuvers, Fortunes, and Locations. When a player has amassed enough Power, he may defeat more powerful enemies from the "Archenemy" deck, including Shelob, The Witch-King, and the Eye of Sauron! Each card acquired during the game has a Victory Point (VP) value with the Archenemy cards providing the most VPs. In the end, whoever has the most VPs wins.

Whether played on its own or combined with the other LotR deck-building games from Cryptozoic, The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King Deck-Building Game introduces a new feature to the game: a map of "The Journey of the Ring". Can you deliver The One Ring to Mount Doom, then destroy it? Some of the cards you play will move the Ring of Power towards Mount Doom on the map, while the minions of Sauron will delay the Ring on its journey. If you fail to destroy The One Ring, Sauron may be too powerful to overcome...

Cryptozoic's The Lord of the Rings/The Hobbit deck-builder series:


The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring Deck-Building Game
The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers Deck-Building Game
The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King Deck-Building Game
The Hobbit: An Unexpected Journey Deck-Building Game
The Hobbit: The Desolation of Smaug Deck-Building Game Expansion Pack
152510.name: The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King Deck-Building Game

152511.name: Die Schweigende Welt
152511.description:
The players have to move 1 meeple (diver) from the starting space to space 90. The red spaces have special meanings, which are explained in the game rules. Also explained are several facts about diving and oceanic life. The winner is the player who gets the most playing chips on the red spaces.

The game was inspired by the 1956 documentary movie "Le Monde du silence" by Jacques-Yves Cousteau and the invention of the aqualung.

152512.name: J-Stars Victory VS
152512.description:
User Summary

J-Stars Victory VS is a fighting game set in the Shonen Jump universe. The game includes a cast of playable and assist characters from different Shonen Jump properties including: Bleach, One Piece, Dragon Ball, Gintama, Hunter x Hunter, Bobobo-bo bo-bobo, Naruto, Rurouni Kenshin, Yuyu Hakusho, and many more.

The player selects a team of two characters and battles against others in one-on-one or multiple opponent matches. To win a match, the player must fill the win gauge, which consists of three sections. To fill the gauge, the player must defeat opponents. There are normal attacks, power attacks, area attacks, and finishing moves.

152513.name: Wheel of Fortune Electronic Game
152513.description:
FROM THE BOX:

The celebrated television game show comes to life in your own living room with this tabletop game! Over 1000 puzzles in your favorite game categories. Tons of fun for friends, families or the ultimate Wheel of Fortune fan!

Just like the show and all other previous version before it you spin the wheel, choose a letter, buy a vowel and solve the puzzle. When the wheel is spun, the seasons 24-26 template scrolls upwards on the LCD screen (and with the gradual movements on the wheel can stop anywhere the player wishes). The game has four rounds including the Jackpot round in round three and the bonus round where you have to spin a smaller-sized 24 wedge wheel and solve one puzzle in order to claim you prize. It follows the rules from season 26 and wedges like Jackpot, Mystery Wedge, Wild Card, Prize Wedge Million Dollar Wedge, gift tag and free spin (shown as "Free Spin + $300" if the wheel stops) are there. It also has QWERTY Keyboard that can only be used with the included stylus pen. and it featured the voice of the late Charlie O'Donnell as host.

A Platinum Edition of the game was released in 2009.

152515.name: Nanoworld: Uniques
152515.description:
Publisher's Blurb

Nanoworld: Uniques contains:

-Additional clone creation options
-New moves for playing unique clones

152516.name: Nanoworld: Unique Edition
152516.description:
Publisher's Blurb

What does it mean to be a clone? A single clone among the many clones of Nano. Alike in every way, you serve your purpose together. That is, until the day when things go wrong.

Nanoworld: A Game of Clones Features:

- Collaborative clone creation
- Just-in-time world building
- Definition of your genotype through play
- Short play time and high replayability
- Rules Powered by the Apocalypse

plus...

Nanoworld: Uniques

-Additional clone creation options
-New moves for playing unique clones

Vital Statistics:
- Format: PDF
- Players: 2 or more
- Duration: 30 minutes or more
- Word Count: 400 words
- License: Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial

152523.description:
Pixel Tactics: Seven Sisters is a mini-expansion for Pixel Tactics that features 16 cards and 8 heroes for use in customizing your Pixel Tactics decks. These eight heroes contain the seven diabolic sisters featured in the boss rush dungeon “The Well of Souls” in BattleCON: Devastation, as well as their butler.

Contains these cards:

Sera Malephaise / Diabolist
Lucida Malephaise / Temptress
Nabatina Malephaise / Judge
Framboise Malephaise / Soothsayer
Ariel Malephaise / Destroyer
Candide Malephaise / Deceiver
Dolores Malephaise / Inquisitor
Simon la Faucheuse / Butler
152523.name: Pixel Tactics: Seven Sisters

152524.description:
The Price of Victory is an 16-card 8 Hero mini-expansion for Pixel Tactics that will give you new options for deckbuilding and casual play. The Price of Victory contains Gerard’s eight Mercenaries featured in BattleCON: Devastation, complete with powerful leadership and hero effects.

It includes these heroes:

Jenniver Van Kenul / Archer
Milton Barts / Bombardier
Antine Frass / Con Artist
Devah Danah / Fistfighter
Gil Gorgeous / Gunslinger
Ven Cresshim / Heavy Knight
Disposable Dave / Lackey
Elgala Richese / Mage
152524.name: Pixel Tactics: The Price Of Victory

152525.description: Pixel Tactics Promo card that is a Master Plan game crossover.
152525.name: Pixel Tactics: Game Show Host/Roy

152526.description: Promo card for Pixel Tactics that is a crossover from the game Noir
152526.name: Pixel Tactics: Reporter / Marion

152528.description: Pixel Tactics Promo card that is a crossover from the Grimoire Shuffle game
152528.name: Pixel Tactics: Apprentice / Verona

152529.description: Pixel Tactics Promo card that is a crossover from the Blades Of Legend Game
152529.name: Pixel Tactics: Collector / Arcus

152530.description: Pixel Tactics Promo card that is a kickstarter/convention promo
152530.name: Pixel Tactics: Game Designer / D. Brad Talton Jr.

152531.description: Pixel Tactics promo card that is a Kickstarter/Convention promo.
152531.name: Pixel Tactics: Game Artist / Fábio Fontes

152533.name: Helballa 80-talet
152533.description: Swedish quiz about things typical for the 80's. The game includes 318 questions and gives some examples on how the game could be played, both in teams or individually.

152536.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 217 - Sep 1993)
152536.description:
Alarums & Excursions
Issue #217
September 1993

Cover art by Kevin Davies.

152537.name: Three Days
152537.description:
Publisher's opening text:

"When Graham first met Joanna, he fell in love instantly.
Joanna knew that there was chemistry, but for her the
feeling of love would take root after three days.
This is a game about those first three days."

User summary:
Three Days plays out the kindling of a relationship between two player characters in the style of a Romantic Comedy. Physical posture, phrasing and knitting all play into the mechanics of this storygame.

152538.name: Imperium Chronicles: Heroes of the Imperium Board Game
152538.description:
Note: This game is no longer available. It was superseded by In Harm's Way Tactics which incorporates many of the mechanics of HofI.

Heroes of the Imperium is a cooperative card/board game set in a science fantasy universe called the Imperium Chronicles. Up to five players work together as heroes on missions against the enemies of the Imperium (Solo play is also supported).

Each new game begins with players choosing from one of six hero archetypes: Assassin, Duelist, Grunt, Medic, Officer, and Psi Mage. Each hero is represented by a Stat card listing his attributes and default abilities/attacks. Each hero also has a deck of Ability cards from which the player can choose up to five. Some Ability cards are marked as "Advanced" and count as two cards. This allows players to choose fewer, but more powerful cards if they wish.

Once player have chosen their heroes and Ability cards, they select a mission to be played. Each mission description includes which enemies will be encountered and what goals the player must meet to win. An Encounter deck can also be used (especially for solo players) to randomize which enemies will be fought during the mission.

Each mission also includes a map of the game board. The board consists of several tiles that players assemble prior to the beginning of play. Paper miniatures, representing both heroes and enemies, are placed on the board and moved on a turn-by-turn basis. Each turn allows players to carry out several actions including attacking, movement, and using items. Control of the enemy side is either done by a single player who chose not to have a hero, or by hero players on a rotating basis.

Enemies in the game are grouped into three main factions: the primitive Ferans, slave-trading Ougluks, and the technologically advanced Warlock Industries. Each enemy, like the heroes, has a Stat card listing its attributes and default abilities/attacks. They do not, however, get additional Ability cards.

152540.name: Cheben
152540.description:
From publisher blurb:

The good folks of Cheben have four problems they need solved. To start things off, the dead have been walking about in the old graveyard and scouts have reported seeing something else skulking around the old mausoleum. Good Father Rollin would go deal with them himself, but he is busy ministering to the spiritual needs of the community.

Second, goblins have been spotted near the old auxiliary armory and it is feared they might have set up a base of operations on the island. The militia would handle the problem, but the mayor worries that the goblins might be engaged in a ruse to lure away the defenders of the town.

Third, an area of woods near the town is permanently in shadow, no doubt due to magic of some sort. Two hunters have gone missing in the woods and others have reported siting strange creatures in the woods. The town wizard would deal with this, but he is busy with critical research, which leads to the final problem.

Kosven, the town wizard, needs some brave souls to investigate an old and abandoned library. The library has reputation for being haunted and no one in the town wants to face what lurks within its walls.

As usual, it is up to starting adventurers to solve the villagers’ problems. Or die trying.

Cheben is a Pathfinder Role Playing Game compatible adventure. It is intended for a party of 1st-3rd level characters.

Here are some of the features of the adventure:

Detailed color maps for the adventure.
Full statistics are included for all encounters—no need to look up monsters.
New Monsters (Paper Phantom, Silent Guardian (Least), Rage Wolf, and Whip Plant).
Retro Art (=Bad Art).
A complete campaign starter adventure with four distinct adventure areas.

152541.name: Rookvale
152541.description:
Publisher's summary:

Demons have beset the realm of Rookvale. Rumours are spreading through the alleyways of each city-province as to where fault lies. Maybe this incursion was planned and bated by patriarchs in neighboring lands. While the origin is unclear, the situation is crystalline: demons roam Rookvale and have started evolving.

You’re one of the bands of misfits, heroes, and dark-art apprentices tasked with fighting back this incursion. But the reigning Demon Lords are nigh invulnerable to mortal weapons. The only way one has a chance at defeating a Demon Lord is to wield the power of a Demon Lieutenant. And in turn, defeating a Demon Lieutenant would require the aid of a Greater Demon. And so begins the circle of weakening, binding, summoning, and controlling. To defeat demons, one must control demons.

Rookvale is a game of cinematic tactical combat based on the Anima Prime engine. The text is short, suitable for those already versed in the art of roleplaying games.

The core rules are available in print-on-demand format as well as full & minimal PDF.

152543.name: Supermarket Sweep Game
152543.description: Based on the hit ITV game show from 1993-2001 & 2007 with Dale Winton as your host, answer questions correctly and go wild in the aisles as you race to get the most items in your trolleys as possible in order to win.

152545.name: Hive of the Giant Bees
152545.description:
Thirty years ago a meteor shower fell onto a remote isle or plateau. As luck would have it, the meteors were composed of some freaky magical or radioactive rock. The rock made the local bumblebees really big. Now, a primitive tribe of the area has taken the giant bees as their new spirit totem.

Oh yeah, and the MacGuffin you're after is in there with all the honey and stingers and stuff.

152546.name: Sakigake!! Otokojuku - Nihon yo, Kore ga Otoko Dearu!
152546.description:
User Summary

Sakigake!! Otokojuku - Nihon yo, Kore ga Otoko Dearu! is a fighting game based on the Sakigake!! Otokojuku manga and anime. The story revolves around a school for troubled teens that tries to reform them through the use of oendan, a Japanese form of a cheer or pep squad.

The game is a one-on-one 3d fighting game that features lethal hazards that the player can utilize or fall victim to.

152547.name: Sand, Oil, and Blood
152547.description:
From the back of the book:

A fast moving miniatures game that provides the feel of modern warfare. Land, sea and air units interact on a 3D battlefield. Armored thrusts are met by guided missiles, APDS rounds, and attack choppers. Defensive positions are pounded by aircraft and artillery, as infantry are all present. All the rules and data you need to refight Desert Storm or other scenarios are included. All you supply is miniatures, dice, and enthusiasm.

While data has been included for all of the major weapon systems of the War in the Gulf, this book is suitable for simulating modern armored combat anywhere in the world.

Includes:
- Rules for modern micro armour
- Complete rules for three dimensional combat
- Data for over 70 vehicles, 40 aircraft, and boats
- Complete combat charts and templates
- Organization charts for over 50 Allied and Iraqi units

122 page softback book

152548.name: Assault on Stalingrad
152548.description:
From July to October 1942, in the area between the Don and Volga Rivers, the German army broke through the Soviet defense and rushed to Stalingrad. They aimed to occupy the important city facilities (such as Mamai Hill, tractor factory and grain silos). However, Soviet reinforcements poured in and fought back.

Urban warfare is expanded on the Stalingrad city mini-map.

Scale
Counters: division, corps
Hex: about 10 km (normal map) / about 2.4 km (Stalingrad city map)
Turn: 4 days

120 counters

152549.name: Trolley Ride
152549.description:
"Game of the Trolley Ride" is typical race spin and move game.
First player starting on Washington street, from the station, moves checker as shown by the indicator.
The player first completing the trip around the line, wins the game.

152550.name: Get Wasted
152550.description:
Get Wasted is english version of the czech most popular beer drinking game Chlastej!

Goal of the game:
You are sitting with your friends in a beautiful pub and think what the hell are we going to do? One of you challenges
everybody to a Competition the first who gets lucky at the whore house wins! Everyone is in so the point of this game is clear –
get from the pub to the whore house first and give the best performance ever. Unfortunately after those few beers the way isnt as easy as it might seem and first you need is a pass from your local pimp. This pass is also confirmation that you have enough money to pay and you can still give a solid performance. You are always leaving the pub with a full pint of beer. On your way through the fields you drink gradually from your pint.

Players rolls the dice and move on the game plan. When the game say player have to drink (usually beer).
First player in the whore house is the winner of the game.

English version Get Wasted is only translation of the popular czech game Chlastej!

152551.description: The board depicts an oval shaped racetrack divided into spaces. The object of the game is to win the race.
152551.name: Bicycle Race

152552.name: The New Electronic Perfect Match Game
152552.description:
FROM THE BOX:

Haven't you always wondered who your perfect match is? The New Perfect Match Game is the fun way to find out. The game is played by couples who are asked a series of questions with four alternative answers supplied. These questions cover topics ranging from sex to politics and the arts. Each partner decides on their favourite response and uses the electronic Perfect Match device to check their compatibility and advance along the board. the first couple to reach the Perfect Match Heart Light are the winners. Who will be your Perfect Match?

Contents:

2 Electronic Perfect Match Devices.
288 Question Cards.
1 Die.
4 Position Markers.
Perfect Match Game Board.

The players are divided into couples. Each couple takes a position marker and places it in the start square. Remove the perfect match cards from their perforations and place them in their marked positions on the game board.

The Perfect Match Cards:
These cards are divided into two categories: pink 'Girls' cards and blue 'Guys' cards. As the game proceeds, question cards are taken from the 'Girls' pile if the playing couple lands on a pink square or From the 'Guys' pile if they land on a blue square. Each card contains one questions with four alternative
answers marked A,B,C or D.

Choosing the right answer:
If the couple lands on a blue square, one of the other players picks up a 'Guys' card and directs one question on it to the male partner. He must choose the alternative which he feels is most appropriate to him. His partner must try to anticipate his feelings or attitudes on that question and choose the same alternative. Couples should be open and honest in their choice of answer. Similarly, if the couple lands on a pink square, a 'Girls' card would be taken and its question directed towards the female partner. She will choose and answer and her partner should try to anticipate this response.

Questions marked 'BOTH' are designed to test compatibility, with each partner choosing their own favourite answer in response to the question asked.

Using the Electronic Perfect Match device:
These devices are in the shape of four hearts joined together. Each heart is labeled A,B,C or D, representing the four alternatives on the Perfect Match question cards. When a question is asked and each partner has silently decided on which alternative to choose, they each hold up their device with the chosen representative letter uppermost. They must not allow each other to see their choices. The two devices are then pressed together. If the electronic tone sounds, a perfect match has been achieved for that question.

Dare Cards:
Scattered throughout both packs of cards are Dare Cards. If one these cards appears, the couple must perform whatever is required of them according to the instructions on the card. Their performance is adequate (as indicated by a show of hands) then the couple may roll the die again and continue their turn. Be warned - if you are too easy on others then there is no challenge to perform well. If you are too tough, then your opponent will be equally tough on you. So be fair!

Playing the game: Each couple rolls the die once and those with the highest score start, moving their marker the corresponding number of squares. One of the other players then reads the first question to the starting couple. If the couple achieves a Perfect Match, they roll the die again and advance the corresponding number of squares along the board. Remember, a couple can only roll the die and advance after they have successfully answered a Perfect Match question or performed a Dare task. The couple continues in this way until they are unsuccessful in either a Perfect Match question or a Dare performance, in which case the control of the game is handed over to the next couple (moving clockwise).

Winning the Game:
The first couple to reach the Perfect Match Heart Light and then successfully achieve a Perfect Match from their Choice of either a Girls or Guys question will be declared the winner.


Special Note


Should the electronic tone stop working use a nail file or a similar tool to lever apart the two case sections of the blue device. Carefully removed the battery, replacing it with one of identical type. Be sure to position it positive side up. When pressing the case sections back together, locate the letter "A" on the plastic cover over the battery position.

Based on the formerly popular 1980s Network Ten (and much later Seven Network in 2002) Australian TV dating game show of the same name.

152555.name: You Don't Know Jack Question Pack

videogamecompilation.152556: You Don't Know Jack Vol. 1 XL

152555.description:
User Summary - Partially borrowed from the original YDKJ entry.

You Don't Know Jack is a trivia game that uses elements of pop culture to ask entertaining trivia questions to the players. The game is structured like a television game show.

This expansion pack contains additional questions for the original You Don't Know Jack, which must already be installed to play the expansion questions.

152556.name: You Don't Know Jack Vol. 1 XL

videogamecompilation.167545: You Don't Know Jack Mega Pack

152556.description:
User Summary

You Don't Know Jack is a trivia game that uses elements of pop culture to ask entertaining trivia questions to the players. The game is structured like a television game show.

This edition combines the original You Don't Know Jack with the first expansion Question Pack.

152557.name: You Don't Know Jack Volume 6: The Lost Coast

videogamecompilation.167545: You Don't Know Jack Mega Pack

152557.description:
User Summary

You Don't Know Jack is a trivia game that uses elements of pop culture to ask entertaining trivia questions to the players. The game is structured like a television game show.

152560.name: Crib-box
152560.description:
From the instruction book:

Crib-box is a two dimensional method of playing cribbage in which twenty-five cards are arranged in a five by five array and scores are made in rows, columns, and diagonals of the array.

Game consists of rule booklet for playing 6 game variants using the special board and two standard decks of patience playing cards provided.

152561.description:
Argent: Summer Break is a tiny 20-card mini-expansion that adds a new voter, new supporters, new vault cards, and a new summer break scenario to the game. These have a much more lighthearted tone, such as a yacht you can use to bribe Consortium Voters, some enchanted beach gear, and more.

The expansion is included as a free reward to Kickstarter backers of Argent: The Consortium and will be available separately.
152561.name: Argent: Summer Break

152563.name: Chetyrestan
152563.description:
A game for 2 players by Stefano Negro.

In the Glorious Republic of Chetyrestan, Comrades are being assigned different accommodations to live in. Players are government planners giving a place to stay to everyone while trying to create a peaceful and functional city.

Components

6 City Stripes (6×1 squares). Each square is in one of the three Building colors (white, black, or green).

36 Buildings divided into:


12 Class A Flat
12 Class B Flat
12 Class C Flat


36 Comrades divided into:


12 Diplomats
12 Bureaucrats
12 Workers


8 District Tokens (2×A, 2×B, 2×C, 2×D)

1 Supervisor Token

Aim of the game

The players place/move Buildings and Comrades trying to get 4 Buildings or 4 Comrades of the same colour in an orthogonal or diagonal row multiple times to create a functional district in Chetyrograd (in order to get rewards).

152564.name: Labyrinth Legends
152564.description:
Are you daring enough, crafty enough, powerful enough to become a legend?

Labyrinth Legends, Creat Studios' quirky and addictive arcade action-adventure dungeon crawler, features a unique combination of crisp graphics and dazzling visuals, inviting exploration, tricky puzzles and exciting monster-slashing arcade action.

Key Game Features

- Explore Mysterious Mazes and Crypts. Collect gold and discover treasure, weapons, artifacts and more within hidden catacombs and anicent tombs of list civilizations.
- Solve Challenging Puzzles. Evade concealed traps, unlock secret passageways and solve an array of intuitive puzzles.
- Battle Foreboding Creatures. Engage into combat against mummies, zombies, ghould and other monsters seeking to defend their turf.
- Local Multiplayer. Become the greatest adventurer with leaderboards, full Trophy support and three different local multiplayer modes for up to four players.

Source: Developer's Website.

152566.name: Zombie Tycoon II: Brainhov's Revenge
152566.description:
It’s zombies vs. zombies and humans are caught in between! Pick your side in the epic war between two masterminds of Evil: apprentice-gone-rogue Orville Tycoon and his army of heavy-duty zombies, or his vengeance-thirsty mentor Professor Brainhov and his rioting mass of twitchy brain-munchers. During the final siege on the human fortress, Brainhov makes a sudden comeback seeking two things: retribution for his apprentice’s betrayal, and to reclaim his rightful throne as alpha mad scientist. Get ready for over-the-top online death matches: pick your faction, Monster and strategy, and find out who gets to become King of the Undead!

Source: The Developer Website.

152567.description:
Basari: Das Kartenspiel keeps the fundamentals of Basari and its sister game Edel, Stein & Reich.

Every round in Basari: Das Kartenspiel, each player receives a card that shows gemstones, victory points (VPs) and 1-4 workers. Players simultaneously choose to do one of the following:


Get another card, adding to their worker total
Score VPs shown on their card
Take the gems specified on their from the back


If only one player chooses a specific action, she takes that action. If exactly two players choose the same action, those players will barter for that action: offering increasingly valuable gems to one another for that action. One of the players will take the gems offered, the other player will take the action. If three or more players choose the same action, the action is forfeited.

The round ends if one or more players have 15 workers after all negotiations and actions have been completed. Each player with 15 or more workers scores 12 VPs. The player(s) with the most gems of each color score additional VPs, but then must return some of their gems back to the bank.

Each player keeps their leftover gems, the cards are shuffled together, and a new round starts.

After three rounds, the game ends. Whoever has the most victory points wins!
152567.name: Basari: Das Kartenspiel

152569.name: Type:Rider
152569.description:
User Summary

Type:Rider is a side-scrolling platformer that chronicles the history of Typography, beginning with Cuneiform and ending with Desktop Publishing. Each world is themed around a particular font or movement ("Gothic," "Garamond," "Helvetica," etc), and is broken up into four levels with a total of 33 collectibles. Collectibles include all 26 letters of the Latin alphabet (formatted in the appropriate font, of course), a hidden ampersand, and six asterisks that unlock historical text.

152570.name: Foosball 2012
152570.description:
For the first time ever, play table football for PlayStation®3 system and PlayStation®Vita system!

Enjoy one of the most popular sports in the world from the comfort of your home on PS3™, or enjoy it anywhere on PS®Vita and challenge your friends in a local multiplayer for up to four players and online multiplayer and leaderboards.

Foosball 2012 brings an unparalleled level of connectivity between PS3™ and PS®Vita, supporting cross play, gameplay continuation and offering both the PS3™ and PS®Vita versions together, for a price of a single game.

Running in astonishing FullHD resolution, 60 frames-per-second graphics and with support for PlayStation®Move controller on the PS3™ and supporting the innovative features of PS®Vita, like rear touch pad and accelerometer-powered controls, Foosball 2012 is the supreme experience for any PlayStation® owner.

- Cross play and gameplay continuation
- PlayStation®Move supported
- Local and online multiplayer
- 9 different tables, 6 balls, customizations

Source: Developer Website.

152571.name: Uncharted 3: Drake's Deception – Game of the Year Edition
152571.description:
User Summary

Uncharted 3: Drake's Deception is the third game in the Uncharted series, created by Naughty Dog for the PlayStation 3. It is the sequel to Uncharted 2: Among Thieves.

According to Sony, the following content is included in the Game of the Year Edition:

Classic Skins Pack 1-3: 25 multiplayer skins, including Nathan Drake's looks from Uncharted 1 and 2
Multiplayer Accessory Pack: Includes Killzone 3 skins and accessories
Flashback Maps 1 and 2: Eight remade maps from Uncharted 1 and 2
Drake's Deception Map Pack: Four new multiplayer maps: The Graveyeard, Old Quarter, London Streets and Oasis
The Fort Co-Op: Takes place in the fortress from Uncharted: Drake's Fortune
Co-Op Shade Survival: Fight against the Djinn (fire enemies from Uncharted 3's final chapters)
Doughnut Skin Pack: Five "fat" skins
Rogues Skin Pack 1 and 2: Skins of 14 enemies

152572.description:
Camp Grizzly is a semi-cooperative survival horror board game.

The Spin the Bottle Expansion includes:

• A 'Spin the Bottle' spinner
• More cards focused on kids being bad
• 18 NEW CABIN/SURVIVAL CARDS INCLUDE: Seven Minutes in Heaven, Snapped, Reverend Conreigh (cameo card and pawn), Strip Poker, I'll Be Right Back, Hedge Clippers, Broken Bottle, Truth or Dare, Cooties (and more!).
• 4 NEW JUMBO FINALES
• NEW COUNSELOR JUMBO CARD AND PAWN: Becky - The 'Queen Bee'
152572.name: Camp Grizzly: Expansion #1 – Spin The Bottle

152574.name: Resident Evil: Chronicles HD Collection
152574.description:
Gear up for the ultimate Resident Evil® shooting experience with RESIDENT EVIL®: CHRONICLES HD COLLECTION.

Use the PlayStation®Move motion controller or traditional wireless controller to take down hordes of zombies across two full titles, RESIDENT EVIL®: THE UMBRELLA CHRONICLES and RESIDENT EVIL®: THE DARKSIDE CHRONICLES.

Relive the events from the original series with classic characters in HD.

Exclusively on PlayStation®Network.

Source: Distributor Website.

152575.name: Tsunami Quarterly Review (Issue 1 - Winter 2013)
152575.description:
Tsunami Quarterly Review
Issue #1
Winter 2013

Cover by Ginny Shepard

152577.name: Welcome to Neuro City
152577.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to Neuro City is a fantasy cyberpunk supplement for Arcana Rising, the H&H System powered game of urban fantasy.

Blending real world and fantasy future alike, Neuro City presents a tightly-packed powder keg of warring corporations, disenfranchised planar refugees, vampiric street gangs, and gun-for-hire "operators" trying to make a living in a future gone just a bit weird.

Inside you'll find:

Detailed setting information on Neuro City and the surrounding Åland Islands
An extensive list of rival factions, from corporations to criminal gangs to the local wizard and cleric orders
Alternate rules for non-human PCs
New hacking rules and the neurocaster class that exploits them
Alternate career option for freelance "operator" PCs
Extensive list of cybernetic implants
New optional rules for magic
Quick and dirty job generator for operator assignments

152578.name: Drums of War
152578.description:
from the Drums of War wiki

Drums of War is a tabletop roleplaying game system, designed to allow you to create your own adventures in the world of the Warcraft games. I created Drums of War as a game design final project, in part out of a desire to be able to play and create in Azeroth with the kind of flexibility that a tabletop RPG allows, to create new characters and adventures and allow players to tell their own stories in the rich and incredibly deep world that the Warcraft presents.

152579.name: NFL Blitz (2012)
152579.description:
The all-new NFL Blitz combines the arcade-style gameplay from the original with the deep, immersive game modes of today! Whether you’re battling your rival in a 7-on-7 grudge match or fighting your way through a season of the Blitz Gauntlet, Every Game Is a Two-Minute Drill!

Source: Distributor Website.

(Online Interactions Not Rated by the ESRB) The big hits and stellar plays are back with all-new NFL Blitz. Featuring a combination of the arcade-style gameplay that made the original a hit and the deep, immersive game modes of today, NFL Blitz is recharged with an energetic, football gaming experience. Whether battling your rival in a 7-on-7 grudge match, fighting your way through a season of the Blitz Gauntlet, or taking over the online Battle Boards in Blitz Battles, Every Game Is a Two-Minute Drill with NFL Blitz!

Source: Distributor Website.

152580.name: Chain Letters
152580.description:
FROM THE BOX:
Chain Letters is a rapid fire game base on the popular TV show. That will test your word power through three exciting rounds.


Race to build up the longest chain of words!
Booby Trap your opponent - predict their next move!
Solve the clue and guess the word to win the game!


Can you make twenty new words starting from BYTE - in just 2 minutes?

Contents:

1 pack of word cards - 600 different start words
4 score pads & pencils
4 privacy screens
1 timer
1 die

152581.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 234 - Feb 1995)
152581.description:
Alarums & Excursions
Issue #234
February 1995

Cover art by Simon Barber.

152583.name: Whisper & Venom
152583.description:
From the Publisher's Website:

At its core, Whisper & Venom is a table-top role-playing adventure module that can be used, with an absolute minimum number of adjustments or modifications, with most any fantasy role-playing game rule set.

There are many additional components in the boxed set version that are designed for richer, more rewarding gameplay including map packs, custom 28 mm miniatures and many more.

It is intentionally written to be evocative of the style of modules from the early 1980′s while utilizing modern production techniques and materials.

The Whisper & Venom Limited Edition Boxed-Set includes-

Original Adventure for lower-level characters
Setting Booklet describing the locale and its inhabitants
Original cover art painted in acrylics by Jeff Dee
Interior illustrations and gameplay cartography by Lloyd Metcalf
2-Sided Color poster-size map hand-drawn by Alyssa Faden
10 custom-sculpted 28mm miniatures facilitated by CenterStage Miniatures . . .

152584.name: Tsunami Quarterly Review (Issue 2 - Spring 2013)
152584.description:
Tsunami Quarterly Review
Issue #2
Spring 2013

Cover by Ginny Shepard

152585.name: Bloodline: Alucinor
152585.description:
From publisher blurb:

Inheritors of this line are afflicted with the same tormented dreams and visions of their originator, who is said to have been haunted by victims of diablerie. These Sandmen extend their Requiem into the realm of dreams through the Insomnium Discipline.

This Mekhet bloodline for Vampire: The Requiem is now available for individual purchase. It was originally printed in Bloodlines: The Hidden.

152586.name: Bloodline: Anvari
152586.description:
From publisher blurb:

Not even the vampiric Embrace allows some undead to escape the embrace of drug addiction. Bearers of this blood suffer obsession with altered states, whether for themselves or by inflicting them upon others through the unique Nepenthe power.

This Daeva bloodline for Vampire: The Requiem is now available for individual purchase. It was originally printed in Bloodlines: The Hidden.

152587.name: Bloodline: Architects of the Monolith
152587.description:
From publisher blurb:

Megalomania compels vampires of this lineage to deviate from even the dementia of other Ventrue. Recognizing themselves as veritable gods in their urban domains, so-called Masons make the gilded cage a Discipline in and of itself.

This Ventrue bloodline for Vampire: The Requiem is now available for individual purchase. It was originally printed in Bloodlines: The Hidden.

152588.name: Tsunami Quarterly Review (Issue 3 - Summer 2013)
152588.description:
Tsunami Quarterly Review
Issue #3
Summer 2013

Cover by Debra Mason

152589.name: Bloodline: Bohagande
152589.description:
From publisher blurb:

Luck follows these wayward Gangrel wherever they go, but so does trouble, jealousy, suspicion and paranoia. Reportedly altered by an encounter with the spirit world itself, these traveling lodestones push their luck and test the tolerance of fellow Kindred.

This Gangrel bloodline for Vampire: The Requiem is now available for individual purchase. It was originally printed in Bloodlines: The Hidden.

152590.name: Bloodline: Gethsemani
152590.description:
From publisher blurb:

Blessed and chosen in life, those indoctrinated as Ecstatics have nothing but affliction and abuse to spread in undeath. Reaped from among stigmatics, they curse unfortunate mortals to exhibit twisted signs of divinity, which feed the vampires’ unholy appetites.

This Nosferatu bloodline for Vampire: The Requiem is now available for individual purchase. It was originally printed in Bloodlines: The Hidden.

152591.name: Bloodline: Khaibit
152591.description:
From publisher blurb:

Quiet and unseen, but omnipresent, the vampires derided as mere servants bear a far more important heritage and duty than even they know. Their unique Obtenebration Discipline is only a hint of their higher calling.

This Mekhet bloodline for Vampire: The Requiem is now available for individual purchase. It was originally printed in Bloodlines: The Hidden.

152592.name: Tsunami Quarterly Review (Issue 4 - Fall 2013)
152592.description:
Tsunami Quarterly Review
Issue #4
Fall 2013

Cover by Ginny Shepard

152593.name: Bloodline: Morotrophians
152593.description:
From publisher blurb:

Reclusive, isolationist and even shut in, the vampires once known as Monks lurk in the corridors and cellars of the looming institutions of the world. Their domains are wards, prisons and care facilities where prey are weak, tired, sickly or held hostage for private dining.

This Nosferatu bloodline for Vampire: The Requiem is now available for individual purchase. It was originally printed in Bloodlines: The Hidden.

152594.name: Bloodline: Nahualli
152594.description:
From publisher blurb:

Originating in Mexico, the derisively named Jekylls search for balance between what they perceive as the two sides of the Kindred spirit: the cultured and genteel, and the ravening Beast. Manners and mayhem are their stock and trade.

This Ventrue bloodline for Vampire: The Requiem is now available for individual purchase. It was originally printed in Bloodlines: The Hidden.

152595.name: Bloodline: Nelapsi
152595.description:
From publisher blurb:

Gluttonous and horrifying hunger defines the Locusts, and makes them a nightmare and threat to even elder Kindred. That this line is largely confined to eastern Europe is cold consolation to vampires who have heard whispers of its legend.

This Daeva bloodline for Vampire: The Requiem is now available for individual purchase. It was originally printed in Bloodlines: The Hidden.

152596.name: Bloodline: Oberlochs
152596.description:
From publisher blurb:

Not all undead choose to haunt the world’s cities. Some prefer backwater towns and isolated communities that they call their own. That’s where the inbred and reclusive Brood sets up house with its kin.

This Gangrel bloodline for Vampire: The Requiem is now available for individual purchase. It was originally printed in Bloodlines: The Hidden.

152597.name: Bloodline: Qedeshah
152597.description:
From publisher blurb:

The self-proclaimed mothers of the undead, the Hierodules claim the religious right — no, duty — to spread their supernatural race. Challengers of the Second Tradition, these vampires are either condemned by Princes or turned to for protection by supplicating wards.

This Mekhet bloodline for Vampire: The Requiem is now available for individual purchase. It was originally printed in Bloodlines: The Hidden.

152598.name: Bloodline: Rakshasa
152598.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mysterious strangers from the East, the Demons allude to divine heritage and a heavenly mission, but show only grace and favor to vampires of the West. The temptations of the foreigners’ services are great, but what ultimate price do they charge?

This Nosferatu bloodline for Vampire: The Requiem is now available for individual purchase. It was originally printed in Bloodlines: The Hidden.

152602.name: Cherry Tree High Comedy Club
152602.description:
Overview

Comedy fanatic and high school student Miley Verisse has decided to set up a comedy club in her school, but her nemesis and the head of the student council, Octavia Richmond, isn’t about to make things easy… The school rules require a minimum of 5 students to set up a new club and Miley is 3 people short! Spring break has just started and Miley has until the end of April to recruit the 3 new members she needs to start the club or Octavia will have the last laugh!

Guide Miley through idyllic Cherry Tree Town as she makes new friends and endeavors to persuade them to join her high school comedy club in this anime-style comic adventure game.

Explore the town and level up Miley’s repertoire of conversational topics by performing different activities such as reading books, watching TV, and visiting the art gallery, then apply those skills to persuade potential recruits to join your new club. Some skills require money to level up, so you will need to find part time jobs such as cleaning the local temple, picking up discarded bottles and making jewelry accessories.

Developed by doujin circle 773 (“Nanami)”, Cherry Tree High Comedy Club features a host of quirky characters, catchy music, and is a must-play for fans of anime and manga and, of course, for anyone who wants to smile!

Features


Build up your conversational skills to recruit up to 6 memorable characters, each with a unique storyline and interact with many more NPCs!
Hours of play – over 4,500 lines of dialogue!
Repertoire system of 12 conversational topics to upgrade and master, such as Video Games, Romance, Politics, Cooking, Sports or just good old chit-chat!
Explore Cherry Tree Town and perform diverse tasks to earn money and spend it on activities that improve your repertoire!
All original, high quality, colorful and warm anime-style graphics with one exceedingly catchy soundtrack!
Daily changing dialogue and special events!
Simple and accessible game mechanics and controls!
New Game+ option – carry Miley’s Repetoire skills over from one game to the next!


Source: The Game Website.

152603.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 238 - Jun 1995)
152603.description:
Alarums & Excursions
Issue #238
June 1995

Cover art by Simon Barber.

152604.name: Glory of the Aesir
152604.description:
Publisher blurb:

Centuries before missionaries had carried Christianity to the shores of Scandinavia, the Norselanders worshiped a pantheon of gods called the Aesir. While Rome was turning its back on Zeus and Hera, the Danes and Nords still offered sacrifices to Odin, Frigg, Freyja, and Thor. To honor the Aesir, the men and dwarves of the north forged totems and weapons imbued with great power.

152605.name: Misericord(e)
152605.description:
Being a record of the Good, Dutiful, and Hard-working Guildspeople of the Town Misericord. Written this year of our gods & Sovereign twelve-hundred and thirty-two and may it please the people of the Land, Empire and Goddess of Mystery to heare these tales as they are writ here as told to the gathered peoples of our Town Misericorde and those guestes which have cross’d our door.

From The Back Of The Book: Misericord(e) is a storytelling and role playing game meant for two to six people. It can be played in two to four hours in an evening, and can be played out over many sessions. As you play, you learn more about
the town of Misericord and its inhabitants. The stories revolve around the members of the Guilds, but they meet many other people (and other beings!) in and around the town, so you’ll learn about and make up things about them, too.

You’ll find in this book what you will need to play. Read it through before you play, and gather the items you’ll need. Then settle in for a lovely evening with tasty food, amazing tales and good friends.

The game is meant to be played over many, many months. It is flexible, so it can be played by a different set of players from month to month—play won’t stop if someone can’t make it.

Play one to three tales in an evening. Record them right in the book, and then you can put it away until next time.

152606.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 239 - Jul 1995)
152606.description:
Alarums & Excursions
Issue #239
July 1995

Cover art by Sue Landerman.

152607.name: Meine erste BrainBox: Die Welt entdecken
152607.description:
From the publisher:
The object of the game is to win as many cards as possible in ten minutes. The first player takes a card from the Brainbox and turns the timer over. The player then has ten seconds to study the picture on the card. When the timer runs out the card is passed to player two and player one rolls the die to see which question is to be asked. The questions are on the reverse of the picture card. Player Two checks the answer by looking at the picture and if it is correct the card is given back to Player One to keep. If the answer is wrong the card is placed back into the Brainbox and the next player chooses a card. Please remember, the answer to the question is on the picture side of the card, so look carefully! The player with the most cards after ten minutes wins! If there is a tie, it's sudden death with both players choosing a card and having to answer all eight questions on the card. The player who answers the most correctly wins! For 1 player Look at the card as above for ten seconds. Then turn the card over and answer all the questions (use a pen and paper to record the answers). If all questions are answered correctly the card is kept. If any answers are incorrect, the card has to be put back in the Brainbox. See how many cards you have after five or ten minutes.

152608.name: Meine erste Brain Box: Auf dem Bauernhof
152608.description:
From the publisher:
The object of the game is to win as many cards as possible in ten minutes. The first player takes a card from the Brainbox and turns the timer over. The player then has ten seconds to study the picture on the card. When the timer runs out the card is passed to player two and player one rolls the die to see which question is to be asked. The questions are on the reverse of the picture card. Player Two checks the answer by looking at the picture and if it is correct the card is given back to Player One to keep. If the answer is wrong the card is placed back into the Brainbox and the next player chooses a card. Please remember, the answer to the question is on the picture side of the card, so look carefully! The player with the most cards after ten minutes wins! If there is a tie, it's sudden death with both players choosing a card and having to answer all eight questions on the card. The player who answers the most correctly wins! For 1 player Look at the card as above for ten seconds. Then turn the card over and answer all the questions (use a pen and paper to record the answers). If all questions are answered correctly the card is kept. If any answers are incorrect, the card has to be put back in the Brainbox. See how many cards you have after five or ten minutes.

152609.name: BrainBox: Köln
152609.description:
From the publisher:

The object of the game is to win as many cards as possible in ten minutes. The first player takes a card from the Brainbox and turns the timer over. The player then has ten seconds to study the picture on the card. When the timer runs out the card is passed to player two and player one rolls the die to see which question is to be asked. The questions are on the reverse of the picture card. Player Two checks the answer by looking at the picture and if it is correct the card is given back to Player One to keep. If the answer is wrong the card is placed back into the Brainbox and the next player chooses a card. Please remember, the answer to the question is on the picture side of the card, so look carefully! The player with the most cards after ten minutes wins! If there is a tie, it's sudden death with both players choosing a card and having to answer all eight questions on the card. The player who answers the most correctly wins! For 1 player Look at the card as above for ten seconds. Then turn the card over and answer all the questions (use a pen and paper to record the answers). If all questions are answered correctly the card is kept. If any answers are incorrect, the card has to be put back in the Brainbox. See how many cards you have after five or ten minutes.

152610.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 243 - Nov 1995)
152610.description:
Alarums & Excursions
Issue #243
November 1995

Cover art by Ken Murray.

152611.name: Crossing Physical Borders
152611.description:
From The Preface: This book provides a brief glimpse of larps, people, ideas and discussions crossing international borders. What is it like, being a larper in another country, and what difficulties might arise when re-running your game somewhere else? What tools and experiences are available, and what might we learn from each other?

In line with the very first publication from Knutepunkt, The Book (2001: 4), we do believe that “openness towards each other, [enabling] new impulses from fellow larpers to cross borders, will take us further”. In view of this, we would also like to focus some attention on the important discussions about what Knutepunkt is, for whom it is intended and what it should encompass. We have gathered some of this year’s quotes from several fora, hoping that they will remind us to continue debating, and continue evolving.

152612.name: Crossing Habitual Borders
152612.description:
From The Preface: This is the part of the book where we try to explore the different ways larping is encouraging us to examine and challenge our own, personal and automatic preconceptions and habits. We do not exist in a vacuum, and neither do our larps. How do we perceive the world? How do we perceive ourselves? What might our larps tell about us, and what kinds of repercussions can they have?

In addition to the articles, we wanted the book to reflect other methods of expressing the diverse ways larping might affect us. Therefore, we have included poems submitted by you – both for inspiration and reflection – and we hope that you will enjoy these beautiful contributions as much as we do.

152613.name: Crossing Theoretical Borders
152613.description:
From The Preface: Knutepunkt is a meeting place, somewhere we can exchange ideas, thoughts and observations. It is a place where theory is crossing borders, and where experience blends with theory.

We want to facilitate the book being read and understood; that the theoretical contributions can be beneficial and not out of reach for any of us, especially not the first-timers at Knutepunkt. Therefore, we have borrowed some conceptual clarifications from nordiclarp.org, trying to make our community and its ideas more accessible. In the words of last year’s editor Juhana Pettersson (2012: 10): “Academic writing about role-playing games has its own venues, leaving us to take a more essayistic approach. I’d say the fight for credibility has been won, so we’re free to focus on what’s truly interesting”; we have also decided that we wanted our theoretical contributions to be shorter and more journalistic, and as catchy and appealing as possible.

152614.description:
Piffle challenges players to win obstacle cards by telling nonsense stories while using strategy to outwit opponents.

Players split into teams or play solo against one another. The
number of teams doesn't matter, but the players should sit
opposite their teammate.

Your team plays Gear, Hero, & Conflict cards to generate points
against the Obstacle.

Each time a player lays down a card they must describe a
story taking place.

Players who are the last to play a card against an obstacle defeat it.

The winner of the game is the team or person who earns 5 obstacle cards.
152614.name: Piffle: An Outlandish Card Game

647.name: Late for the Sky Production Company

152615.description:
ZOMBIE-Opoly Allows players to buy their favorite Zombies and increase the rent by buying boxes of flesh and trading them in for a screaming human. Choose your token and shamble to RRrrrrr. You may soon be re-animated or you may just be blood spewed and bitten.

•Comes with 6 player pieces and 2 dice
•Player pieces consist of, a shovel, Severed Ear, Femur Bone, Lethal Weapon, Zombie Boy and a Human Remnant
•Same classic game, with a Zombie twist
152615.name: Zombie-opoly

152616.name: GEMS: the mining game
152616.description:
A fast and exciting game with a unique multi level board and operating system. about digging gems out of the board.
This is done by firstly throwing a colour dotted dice and digging the gem of that colour, after the first turn you can use the gems you have already dug to activate the board to dig various different actions, from TWO'S UP, digging a gem and the one underneath, LUCKY STRIKE, dig and two gems of the same type, ALL CHANGE, which allows you to turn the board and change which gem does which action, and you get to take two different gems of your choice, WHITE WONDER, this allows you to dig a diamond, this is the only way to get them.
This is all done with the aim to collect as many of one gem as possible which will score you more the more you have plus the diamonds which each have a fixed value. The winner is the one with the most points.

152617.description:
Swedish children's game, based around the popular comic Bamse. A dice-rolling game with modular (although not variable) boards, where the object is to get four pieces in a row, in a Bingo like fashion.

Players take turn rolling the two dice, covering (if possible) the target space with a jar of "dunderhonung". White is a wild color and players can then choose freely in which column to place their jar.

The components are all made of thick, sturdy wood.
152617.name: Bamse 4 i rad

152618.name: Are You My Baby?: Animal Game
152618.description:
Players take on the role of an animal (dog, cat, bunny, chicken) and spin and move through farmyard spaces of various colors looking for their three baby animals. The first player to find all three of their babies and return home is the winner.

The pieces are all magnetic, as is the board.

152619.name: Das Warum-Quiz
152619.description:
Why stars shine? Why tiger has stripes? And why the flowers smell? Can you answer these questions already? Test your knowledge on the topics: animals, environment, science and discoveries, idioms, the earth, the human body and nature.

Correct answer gives You point. There are 100 cards in this game. If the deck is exhausted the player with the most points wins.

152620.name: Das Quiz der Tiere
152620.description: How well do you know from the animal kingdom? Test your knowledge with your friends or your family with this exciting quiz with 100 cards. Each correct answer gives You a point. If the deck is exhausted the player with the most cards wins.

152621.description: More 50 black stories with the theme "medizine". How could that have happened? Black Stories are fiddly, morbid and mysterious riddles for teenagers and adults. The players try to reconstruct the crime by asking, guessing and fiddling about. A spooky card game just right for any party.
152621.name: Black Stories: Medizin Edition

152622.description: 50 black stories at office. How could that have happened? Black Stories are fiddly, morbid and mysterious riddles for teenagers and adults. The players try to reconstruct the crime by asking, guessing and fiddling about. A spooky card game just right for any party.
152622.name: Black Stories: Office Edition

152623.name: Rrrunter vom Bock!
152623.description: The goal of Rrrunter vom Bock! is to occupy the center space (bock) with a meeple. The meeples move according to the roll of a die. Whenever a player gets a meeple on the bock, he gets a coin from the cash box and the meeple which previously occupied the bock, is eliminated from the game. Meeples which pass space 17 are also eliminated. Each player has 4 meeples. The player of the last meeple to occupy the bock, gets the rest of the coins in the cash box and wins the game. Meeples which get thrown out by other meeples can be brought back into the game again, if they are not thrown out by other meeples of the same color. If a meeple has passed the bock it can be brought back to the starting Point, if it gets on Space 13 or 17 (or is thrown out by an opposing meeple). The game was published in the 1930s and 40s.

152624.name: Book of Records, Vol. I: Knights
152624.description:
From the back cover:

Your own personal, magical scribe

Let's face it – record-keeping is at the bottom of the RPG Fun List, just above fumbling a roll to resist poison. But it doesn't have to be that way. Enter the Book of Records, Vol. I.

This digital download bundle includes a set of two-page record sheets for knight characters in the King Arthur Pendragon roleplaying game. The easy-to-use PDF files are like the character sheets of yore – only imbued with the binary magic of the 21st century, where auto-filling and auto-calculating form fields abound.

The sheets are compatible with the standard warrior-cultures from the Book of Knights & Ladies and are suitable for use in all phases of The Great Pendragon Campaign. Presented in gorgeous full-color, printer-friendly black-and-white versions of the sheets are included as well.

These remarkable sheets allow both players and Gamemasters to spend less time crunching numbers and more time cracking ribs – as it should be.


From publisher's description:

This first Book of Records features a two-page autofilling character record for a knight character in King Arthur Pendragon. This PDF record works for all Phases of the Pendragon Campaign, though a separate sheet suitable for Late Phase knights is included. Both record sheets are also offered in printer-friendly black-and-white versions. The PDF product automatically completes a variety of calculations based on your character choices, including all the options introduced in the Book of Knights & Ladies. The sheet tracks Fealty and Homage, the new Loyalty Passions introduced in the Book of the Estate, though that supplement is not required for play.

Additional features:


Choose from 13 different cultural backgrounds, from Aquitanian (Arian Christian) to Saxon (Germanic Pagan), though Cymric (British Christian) is the default selection.
Your cultural selection automatically indicates the Personality Traits associated with your knight’s Religious Bonus and autofills the starting values for all Personality Traits.
Armor Type, Horses, and a number of fields associated with your knight’s family, including Family Characteristic, feature pull-down menus of the all the available options. The campaign year that a specific horse becomes available is noted as well!
All of the Derived Statistics (e.g. Damage and Healing Rate) are automatically calculated and filled based on your Primary Statistics (e.g. Strength).
The Glory Total noted on the front page automatically updates based on Glory gains and losses you note on back page.
Most fields can be overwritten by the player to allow for house rules and character maintenance over time.


King Arthur Pendragon is a streamlined game system, but knights undergo constant change and growth. The record sheets included here allow your characters to remain current and dramatically simplifies the creation of new knights — PC’s and NPC’s alike! Future volumes of the Book of Records are planned, including auto-calculating records for Estates and Honours, Continental characters and Ladies.


User comment about the PDF:

PDF contains 14-page booklet plus four 2-page character sheets (early-phase and late-phase, each in greyscale and colour) for a total of 22 pp.

Title is generally given as Book of Records, Vol. 1: Knights, but title page spells out "Volume" in full and uses Roman numeral.

152625.name: Tricky Tracks
152625.description:
Each player in Tricky Tracks starts with nine square tiles, with each card showing some combination of railway tracks and possibly one or more colored stations. The game board features a 2x2 grid onto which players can place tiles, with tracks leading into these tiles and pairs of four colored stations (red, green, blue and yellow) surrounding this playing area.

On a turn, a player places one of her tiles onto one of the four locations in the grid, then scores for each pair of same-colored stations that she connects. Once everyone has placed all of their tiles, the player with the most points in her lowest-scoring color wins!

152626.description:
THE BIG BANG THEORY Ultimate Genius Party Game features 4 different game challenges, each inspired from some of THE BIG BANG THEORY'S funniest moments. Players are divided into 2-4 teams and roll a special die each turn to determine which game they will play. These games include Counterfactuals, Fun with Flags, Sketch Charades, and Celebrity.

In Counterfactuals, a member of the opposite team will draw a card that suppose a world that is different from our own in one key aspect, and asks a question about that world. The competing teammates must choose from multiple-choice answers, and gain points if their answers match each other's, as well as if they match the game writers' answer.

The goal in Fun with Flags is for a player to guess flags from a deck of cards based on clues given by a teammate. The twist is that there are 3 Oops Words that the Clue-Giver cannot say.

Sketch Charades is a simple drawing game, where one teammate will draw a card with a phrase, then has to draw it for another teammate to guess. Finally, Celebrity is a charades game, in which one teammate is chose to be the Actor and all the other teammates are the Guessers. An opposing team chooses answers for each of 5 categories for the Actor to act out.
152626.name: The Big Bang Theory: Ultimate Genius Party Game

boardgamefamily.21932: TV Series: The Big Bang Theory

152627.name: Technical Readout: Project Phoenix
152627.description:
From the back of the book

As the FedCom Civil War swung into high gear and conflict swept through the Inner Sphere, the need for additional war materials was paramount. However, unlike many companies, which produced new, but expensive, BattleMechs, a new upstart company, Vicore Industries, took a different route. By taking centuries old machines and upgrading both their physical as well as technological capabilities, Vicore almost single handedly started a revolution that provided a cheap means to bring 'new' BattleMechs to the field commanders desperate for more assets.

Classic BattleTech Technical Readout: Project Phoenix provides descriptions, game statistics and illustrations for twenty-nine classic BattleMechs that have been upgraded both in appearance and technology. Also, for the first time in any technical readout, additional illustrations representing all the variants for every design in the book are also included.

152628.name: Technical Readout: 3039
152628.description:
From the back cover

In 2781 the Star League was officially abandoned, ending a two hundred year-long Golden Age. In 2785 the Successor Lords launched a series of massive conflicts that would rage for centuries and become known as The Succession Wars. Such endless warfare has taken its toll and by the Fourth Succession War of 3028, the technology employed on the battlefields is a mere shadow of the height of the Star League. However, the discovery of the Helm Memory Core is beginning to unlock such sought-after secrets, with new BattleMechs and experimental technologies starting to make a debut for the first time in centuries.

Classic BattleTech Technical Readout: 3039 is the perfect "first Technical Readout" companion to the Classic BattleTech Introductory Box Set. Combining the ’Mechs, vehicles and aerospace fighters previously found in Technical Readout: 3025 Revised and Technical Readout: 3026 Revised, this volume features some of the most common units of the Succession Wars. Each machine is illustrated in detail, accompanied by a description of its history, capabilities, game stats, along with their most famous pilots.

152629.name: Marital Bliss
152629.description:
At the start of the two-player card game Marital Bliss, each player draws seven missions that they must complete in secret for their partner over the next seven days. Mission cards range from housework chores (such as taking out the trash) to more complex activities such as organizing a weekend away. Each mission card also has a brownie point option that can be completed for extra points.

Players can choose to discard any number of mission cards at the start of the game if they feel they cannot complete them. Different missions are worth a different number of points, and any uncompleted missions at the end of the week are worth negative points. If the other player guesses a mission you are attempting (or recently completed), then you gain no points for the mission.

Strategy cards are mixed with the mission cards and allow players to change the rules of the game by making the other player discard missions, allowing some free guesses, or simply gaining points for a guessed mission.

Players also draw five reward cards and choose the one they would most like to win. A players cards are keep secret from their opponent.

The player with the most points at the end of the week earns a reward card to be used at their discretion.

boardgamecompilation.154029: Es war einmal: Magische Märchen & Ritterliche Romanzen

152630.description: In Once Upon a Time, players tell a story together using cards that show fairytale elements and endings. Now add more valorous deeds to your game with the Knightly Tales expansion. Inspired by legends of gallant knights and their ladies, the 38 Story Cards and 17 Ending Cards in this set can be shuffled into your Once Upon a Time storytelling card game deck to add chivalrous themes and more variety to your game. For an even stronger knightly feel, try removing some of the core Story or Ending Cards.
152630.name: Once Upon a Time: Knightly Tales

1234.name: Once Upon a Time: The Storytelling Card Game

152632.name: The Rifter (Issue 64 - Nov 2013)
152632.description:
From the Back of the Book
The Rifter® #64 is our annual horror issue. This one presents chills and monsters for Beyond the Supernatural™, Dead Reign™, Nightbane® and even for the Palladium Fantasy RPG®. There is a "Giant" adventure (as in an adventure about Giants) for Palladium Fantasy®, and The Black-Malice Legacy, Part Two, with more details about the Coalition States' Psi-Division. Plus, stories, news, coming attractions, and more.
Every issue of The Rifter® is an idea factory that helps players and Game Masters to generate new ideas and keep their games fresh. It provides useful, ready to go, source material gamers can just drop into their ongoing games. A doorway to new possibilities and numerous Palladium role-playing worlds. It offers new characters, O.C.C.s, powers, magic, weapons, adventure and ideas for your games. It presents new villains, monsters and dangers to battle, and new ideas to consider. Every issue has material for Rifts® and at least two or three other Palladium game lines.
The Rifter® Number 64 includes:
Rifts® - The Black-Malice Legacy, Part II - by Matt Olfson and Will Hunter. Source material about the Coalition States' psionic operatives and technology, including squad formation and new psychic martial art classes for special operatives in CS Psi-Battalion.
Rifts® Short Story - A Cold Night, Dead Past by Brett Caron.
Dead Reign™ source material by Jeff Duncan. New Survivor Occupations and related skills set in the Zombie Apocalypse.
Nightbane® source material by Bryant Telfer. A new class of mystical wanderer and Nightbane.
Palladium Fantasy® Adventure by Michael Osborne. Play Giant characters or pint-sized humans who invade the lairs of Trolls and evil beings in control of dark magic.
Palladium Fantasy RPG® - New creatures: Ice Bearmen and the Winter Serpent by Matthew Clements, Chuck Walton and Kevin Siembieda. "Official" Fantasy source material.
Rifts® NG/Minion War™ story (and hint of things to come) by Matthew Clements.
Heroes Unlimited™ Short Story by Glen Evans.
News, coming attractions, product descriptions and more.

152633.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 244 - Dec 1995)
152633.description:
Alarums & Excursions
Issue #244
December 1995

Cover art by Simon Barber.

152634.name: Elementary: The Chemistry Card Game
152634.description:
Welcome to Elementary!. You have less than 48 hours to craft the most potent compounds before your lab burns down! Can you avoid the flames and beat the clock? Through skillful use of Lab Techniques, Element management and clever Time Track play, opponents gather the right combination of Elements and Bonds to score their chemical creation! But beware! Your esteemed colleagues are doing the same! Will they sabotage your best efforts? Or will you both end up in smoke?

Game Goal:
Complete compounds and collect glassware sets to score the most victory points before your lab burns down.

For 1 to 4 players. A two player game is about 30 minutes. Solo play is 15 minutes.

Game Turn info:

1. Add one Starter Element by flipping over card and sliding Element / Bond trackers on your lab.

2. Do a time action (Element, Compound or Fire Extinguisher) and move your scientist that many hours in the Lab.

Move your scientist tracker on the time track when performing a time action. Whoever is behind on the time track gets to work in the lab.
Tie goes to the active scientist. When you reach or pass a Research / Development space, add one to your Lab.

When you land on a fire hazard, add 1 fire strip to your lab. Either cover common or uncommon elements.

After you have used all Starting Elements, pick them up again to use for your next turn.

When 2 of the Element stacks are depleted on the Time Track, remove all remaining Element cards and refill all four spots with
new Elements as in the setup.

Game Components:

4 Laboratory Player Boards
1 Time Track Lab
62 Element cards
32 Starter Element cards
58 Lab Technique cards
60 Compound cards
4 Player Action / End of Game
Bonus Scoring Reference cards
8 Player tokens
4 Research / Development charts
16 Research / Development markers
6 Dual Fire Extinguisher cards
